name: bactrian
content:
Bactrian noun
(ANIMAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] (also bactrian, bactrian camel) (also Bactrian camel) a type of camel (= a large animal that lives in the desert) with two humps (= raised areas) on its back: Camels, whether the single-humped dromedary or the two-humped Bactrian, are not easily loveable creatures. The picture showed him astride a Bactrian camel on the Great Wall of China. Compare
camel (ANIMAL)
dromedary
GlobalP/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages

Bactrian noun
(ANCIENT PEOPLE)
[ C ] a person from the ancient Asian country of Bactria: the king of the Bactrians
[ U ] the language spoken by Bactrians: Latin, Greek, Bactrian, and (ancient) Slavonic have fewer declensions than Sanskrit.
More examplesFewer examplesHe established his rule over the Bactrians, Indians, and Cilicians.He could be a Mede, a Persian, or a Bactrian.
